basic.floral_language:
Echeveria Monroe
Floriography: tenacious, brave, unique
Is a hybrid of Echeveria laui, has a beautiful plant form, fleshy leaves similar to Echeveria laui, oval shape slightly tipped, surface covered by a layer of white powders, leaves arranged in a rosette, like a blooming lotus flower, in a cool season with adequate sunlight, leaf edges turn dark red, very high ornamental value 
Likes sunshine, has a short dormant period under summer high temperature, need place under bright scattered light. Flowers sometimes, orange color.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, orange red flowers
basic.color: Leaf color gray green, when sunny turning to fuchsia

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, dormant in summer under high temperatures, put in places with scattered light
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
